title: Projection body
summary: In convex geometry, the projection body Π K {\displaystyle \Pi K} of a convex body K {\displaystyle K} in n-dimensional  Euclidean space is the convex body such that for any vector u ∈ S n − 1 {\displaystyle u\in S^{n-1}} , the support function of Π K {\displaystyle \Pi K} in the direction u is the (n – 1)-dimensional volume of the projection of K onto the hyperplane orthogonal to u.
